item.title: Administration Division: Roof Replacements Scheduled for Summer Months
item.description: All members of the campus community should note that roof replacements are scheduled for the Materials Research Center (MRC), Empire State Hall (ESH), and the west wing of the Jonsson Rowland Science Center (JRSC). Construction will begin on Monday, June 17 and be completed by Friday, August 9, with tentative daily work hours set for 6:00AM to 2:30PM, Monday through Friday.

item.title: ICAD 2024 Scheduled for June 24-28
item.description: Scheduled for June 24-28, 2024, the International Conference on Auditory Display is a highly interdisciplinary conference with relevance to researchers, practitioners, artists, and graduate students working with sound to convey and explore information, and is unique in its specific focus on auditory displays and the range of interdisciplinary issues related to their use.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Researchers Upend Theory About the Formation of the Milky Way Galaxy
item.description: Heidi Jo Newberg, Ph.D., a professor of astronomy at Rensselaer; Tom Donlon, Ph.D., a visiting researcher at Rensselaer and a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Alabama; and their team have recently published research that reveals a shocking discovery about the history of our universe: the Milky Way Galaxy’s last major collision occurred billions of years later than previously thought.
item.author: Community

item.title: Former RPI Hockey Captain Helps Florida Everblades Win ECHL Kelly Cup
item.description: Former Rensselaer men’s hockey captain Will Reilly ‘20 and the Florida Everglades claimed the ECHL Kelly Cup this past weekend with a 4-1 series victory against the Kansas City Mavericks. Reilly played a key role in the Everblades’ 4-3 overtime victory in game five, as he provided the assist on Matt Weldman’s series-winning score with 3:38 elapsed in the extra period.

item.description: Jim Hendler, who leads Rensselaer’s Future of Computing Research and has studied artificial intelligence for years, is featured in a segment which recently appeared on the Spectrum News 1 local news channel.

item.title: Study Abroad Applications Now Being Accepted for Spring 2025
item.description: The Office of International Programs’ application portal is now open to undergraduate students who wish to apply for spring 2025 study abroad. Deadlines, contact info, and application guidelines are available via the International Programs website.

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review Scheduled for June 20
item.description:
Date: Thursday, June 20, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential….
